structure.unit: STATE UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES -- REGIONAL EDUCATION -- ARCHAEOLOGY

law.catch_line: Provision of vaccination information regarding meningococcal meningitis disease to postsecondary students.

text.section: Each public or private educational institution that offers a postsecondary degree and has a residential campus shall provide vaccination information on meningococcal meningitis disease to full-time students living in resident housing.

The vaccination information shall be contained in the student housing or enrollment application or lease document and shall include a space for the student to indicate whether or not the student has received the vaccination against meningococcal meningitis disease. If institutions provide electronic enrollment or registration to first-time students, the information required by this section may be provided or collected electronically.

Vaccination information about meningococcal meningitis disease shall include detailed information on the risks of the disease and any recommendations issued by the National Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
The vaccination information obtained under this section that is in the possession of the educational institution is confidential and shall not be a public record.
This section shall not be construed to require the educational institution or the Cabinet for Health and Family Services to provide or pay for the meningococcal meningitis disease vaccination.

law.history: Amended 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 139, effective June 20, 2005. -- Created 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 146, sec. 2, effective July 13, 2004.
